revised_title: Differential Gene Expression in Barley Endosperm and its Impact on Seed Protein Accumulation
tldr: This article discusses the differential gene expression in the developing barley endosperm and its role in the regulation of plant growth and development. The authors focus on the prolamin storage proteins, which account for 50% of the seed proteins, and their encoding genes. They also explore the tissue-specific and developmental regulation of these genes, as well as the impact of plant nutrition on their expression.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Genetics
